setwd("\\\\files.kent.ac.uk/usersy/yc336/home/Essential-User-Settings/Desktop/Kent 1st sem/Actuarial Research/w12")
babies <- read.table("babies.txt", header = TRUE)

oil <- read.table("oil.txt", skip = 13, header = TRUE)

oil <- read.table("\\\\files.kent.ac.uk/usersy/yc336/home/Essential-User-Settings/Desktop/Kent 1st sem/Actuarial Research/w12/oil.txt", skip = 15)
names(oil)

#To assign new names use
names(oil) <- c("X1", "X2", "X3", "X4", "Y")

#alternatively
oil <- read.table("oil.txt", skip = 15, col.names = c("X1", "X2", "X3", "X4", "Y"))


#the variable with values coded numerically, like parity or smoke, R will read these as numeric variables and you have to convert to factors use as.factor()
summary(babies$parity)
babies$parity <-as.factor(babies$parity)

#Note that for factors, the summary() function just gives the number of observations that have each factor level.
